timeline.message:
Fixes interoperability issues with CompletableFuture

Subclasses DelegatingCompletableFuture and
AbstractInvocationFuture manage their own completion
value state separately from superclass
CompletableFuture. However CompletableFuture's
methods make use of private CompletableFuture state
resulting in broken interoperability.

timeline.bodyText: This test would fail with IllegalStateException because the response thread that completes the setAsync stage is not allowed to make the getAsync remote call. Changing the default dependent action executor to DEFAULT_ASYNC_EXECUTOR fixes this.

timeline.message:
Fixes interoperability issues with CompletableFuture

Subclasses DelegatingCompletableFuture and
AbstractInvocationFuture manage their own completion
value state separately from superclass
CompletableFuture. However CompletableFuture's
methods make use of private CompletableFuture state
resulting in broken interoperability.

Use async executor for dependent actions from default methods

As described in asynchronous methods javadoc (eg in
IMap), default non-async method callbacks
must be executed by the DEFAULT_ASYNC_EXECUTOR.
See #16154 for reasoning.

Return cached value under concurrent requests

In ClientDelegatingFuture when the current thread
doesn't win the CAS to set the cached deserialized
value, return the same deserialized instance that
is cached. The same behaviour applies in superclass
DelegatingCompletableFuture.

timeline.bodyText: Minor: why do we not want the parent to listen to the future completion instead?
timeline.author: mmedenjak

replies.bodyText: We want to ensure that decodedResponse is initialized to VOID before the dependent action in whenComplete is executed. If the delegate future (clientInvocationFuture) is completed concurrently, it may be the case that the dependent action is executed before the constructor is done -> if the dependent was already registered in super constructor it might observe decodedResponse as null instead of VOID and break the value resolution logic (client message decoding, deserialized value caching etc).
replies.author: vbekiaris
